sen.j: 宇治駅（うじえき）は、京都府宇治市にある、京阪電気鉄道京阪宇治線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, Uji Station is a stop on the Keihan Uji Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.
Uji Station, located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Uji Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.
Uji Station, located in Uji City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Uji Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 宇治線の終着駅である。
sen.e: It is a terminal station of the Uji Line.
It is a terminal station of the Uji Line.
It is a terminal station of the Uji Line.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）の宇治駅 (JR西日本)とは、淀川を挟み、道路上の距離で約890m離れている。
sen.e: The distance between this station and Uji Station of West Japan Railway Company (JR West), located across the Yodo-gawa River, is approx. 890 m along the road available.
The distance between this station and Uji Station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West), located across the Yodo-gawa River, is approximately 890 meters along the available road.
The distance between this station and Uji Station of the West Japan Railway Company (JR West), located across the Yodo-gawa River, is approximately 890 meters along the available road.

sen.j: 駅名が同じで紛らわしいため、一般的には京阪宇治駅と呼ばれる。
sen.e: This station is usually called Keihan Uji Station, because it is confusing that the two stations have the same station name.
This station is usually called Keihan Uji Station, because it's confusing that the two stations have the same name.
This station is usually called Keihan Uji Station, because it's confusing that the two stations have the same name.

sen.j: 同様に、JRの駅もJR宇治駅と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Likewise, Uji Station of JR West is also called JR Uji Station
Likewise, Uji Station of JR West is also called JR Uji Station.
Likewise, Uji Station of JR West is also called JR Uji Station.

sen.j: 休日には観光客で賑わう。
sen.e: On holidays, theis station is crowded with tourists.
On holidays, the station is crowded with tourists.
On holidays, the station is crowded with tourists.

sen.j: 毎年時期によっては大変混雑し、駅前ロータリーに切符売り場が臨時増設されるほどである。
sen.e: In some seasons, it is so much crowded that temporary ticket-selling counters are provided additionally in the rotary in front of the station.
In some seasons, it's so crowded that additional, temporary ticket-selling counters are provided in the rotary in front of the station.
In some seasons, it's so crowded that additional, temporary ticket-selling counters are provided in the rotary in front of the station.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 頭端式ホーム1面2線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅である。
sen.e: It is located on the ground level, with a platform serving two tracks, and since it is a terminal station, one end of the platform is expanded to both track sides, providing a spacious plane area.
It is located on the ground level, with a platform serving two tracks, and since it's a terminal station one end of the platform is expanded to both track sides, providing a spacious open area.
It is located on the ground level, with a toothed platform serving two tracks, where one end of the platform is expanded to both track sides, providing a spacious open area.
sen.cmt: 頭端式ホームの説明を一部変更しました。

sen.j: 駅舎および改札口はホーム頭端部にある。
sen.e: The station house and entrance/exit place are located on the spacious plae area at the end of the platform.
The station house and entrance/exit are located on the spacious open area at the end of the platform.
The station house and ticket gate are located on the spacious open area at the end of the platform.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: 改札口は1か所。
sen.e: Only one entrance/exit place is provided.
Only one entrance/exit place is provided.
Only one ticket gate is provided.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: ホーム有効長は5両。
sen.e: The effective platform length is that for five-car trains.
The effective platform length is sufficient to accommodate a five-car train.
The effective platform length is sufficient to accommodate a five-car train.

sen.j: 大半の列車は2番線から発車する。
sen.e: Most of the trains depart from track 2.
Most of the trains depart from track 2.
Most of the trains depart from Platform 2.

sen.j: 1番線は平日の朝ラッシュ時と夜間のみに使用されており、土曜・休日は1日1本のみ発着する。
sen.e: Track 1 is used only in the mornig rush hours and in the night of the weekdays, and only a train arrives at and departs from this track on Saturdays and Sundays.
Track 1 is used only in the morning rush hours and in the night on weekdays, and trains only arrive at and depart from the track on Saturdays and Sundays.
Platform 1 is used only in the morning rush hours and in the night on weekdays, and only one train arrives at and departs from there on Saturdays and Sundays.
sen.cmt: 1番線→Platform 1 としました。Only one train としました。

sen.j: 発車メロディが使用されている。
sen.e: A melody is used for notifying a train deaparture.
A melody is used to indicate a train's departure.
A melody is used to indicate a train's departure.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 1913年（大正2年）6月1日 京阪宇治線開通と同時に開業。
sen.e: June 1, 1913: The Keihan Uji Line started its operation and operation of this station started at the same time.
June 1, 1913: The Keihan Uji Line and this station started their operations at the same time.
June 1, 1913: The Keihan Uji Line and this station started their operations at the same time.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged and this station became a station of Keihanshin-kyuko-dentetsu (Hankyu Corporation).
October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged, and this station became a station of Keihanshin-kyuko-dentetsu (Hankyu Corporation).
October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged, and this station became a station of Keihanshin Express Electric Railway (Hankyu Corporation).
sen.cmt: 京阪神急行電鉄→Keihanshin Express Electric Railway としました。

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月1日 会社分離により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a station of Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a facility of Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a facility of Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1967年（昭和42年）5月28日 ＰＴＣ使用開始。
sen.e: May 28, 1967: Use of PTC started.
May 28, 1967: The use of PTC started.
May 28, 1967: The use of PTC started.

sen.j: 1995年（平成7年）6月17日 駅前再開発により現在地へ新築移転。
sen.e: June 17, 1995: The station was moved to the present site, corresponding to the redevelopment of the area in front of the station.
June 17, 1995: The station was moved to the present site, corresponding to the redevelopment of the area in front of the station.
June 17, 1995: The station was moved to the present site, corresponding to the redevelopment of the area in front of the station.

sen.j: 1996年（平成8年）10月1日 新駅舎が「グッドデザイン」に選定される。
sen.e: October 1, 1996: The new station house was selected as the one with a good design.
October 1, 1996: The new station house was selected as the one with a good design.
October 1, 1996: The new station house was selected as the one with a good design.

sen.j: 1997年（平成9年）8月5日 社有地有効利用の一環として、駅複合型商業施設を備えた京阪宇治ビルがオープン。
sen.e: August 5, 1997: Keihan Uji Building, multi-purpose commecial facilities, opened to promote more effective use of the land owned by the railway comapany.
August 5, 1997: The Keihan Uji Building, a multipurpose commercial facility, opened in order to promote the more effective use of the land owned by the railway company.
August 5, 1997: The Keihan Uji Building, a multipurpose commercial facility, opened in order to promote the more effective use of the land owned by the railway company.

sen.j: 2000年（平成12年）9月19日 第1回「近畿の駅百選」に選ばれる。
sen.e: September 19, 2000: This station was selected in the first event of a selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
September 19, 2000: This station was chosen in the first selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
September 19, 2000: This station was chosen in the first selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.

sen.j: 現駅舎は1991年12月より移設工事が進められ、1995年6月に旧駅から切り替え、供用を開始した。
sen.e: The work to build a station at a new site was started in December of 1991 and operation using the new station house, instead of the former one, started in June of 1995.
The work of building a station at a new site was started in December 1991, and the new station house assumed the operations of the old one in June 1995.
The work of building a station at a new site was started in December 1991, and the new station house assumed the operations of the old one in June 1995.

sen.j: 旧駅に比べて180m三室戸方へ後退したが、これによりロータリーやタクシー待機場を備える駅前広場が出来た。
sen.e: The new station house is located nearer to Mimurodo station by 180 m than the former one, but for this reason, a square provided with a rortary and taxi-waiting space has become available in front of the station.

The new station house is located 180 meters nearer to Mimurodo Station than the former one was, but for this reason a square provided with a rotary and taxi-waiting space has been made available in front of the station.

The new station house is located 180 meters nearer to Mimurodo Station than the former one was, but for this reason a square provided with a rotary and taxi-waiting space has been made available in front of the station.

sen.j: この後も後述の駅ビルの建設と駐輪場の設置を進め、本格的に1996年12月から、駅前に駅コンコース兼、商業施設が入る、京阪宇治ビルの建設を開始、翌年の1997年8月にオープンした。
sen.e: Even after this, the station building, to be described later, has been constructed as well as a bicycle-parking space, and then in December of 1996, construction of Keihan Uji Building, which is now used as a concourse and accomodates commercial facilties, started at a full scale in front of the station, and the buiding opened in August of 1997.

Even after this, the station building, to be described later, has been constructed as well as a bicycle-parking space, and then in December 1996 the construction of the Keihan Uji Building--which is now used as a concourse and accommodates commercial facilities--started at full scale in front of the station, and the building opened in August 1997.

Even after this, the station building, to be described later, has been constructed as well as a bicycle-parking space, and then in December 1996 the construction of the Keihan Uji Building--which is now used as a concourse and accommodates commercial facilities--started at full scale in front of the station, and the building opened in August 1997.

sen.j: 現在はアンスリーが入居しているが、オープン当初は、2階に旧・京阪宇治交通の「リムジンセンターU-ハウス京阪宇治」があった。
sen.e: an3 is now located in the building, but when the building opened, the U-house Keihan Uji limousine center of the defunct Keihan Uji Kotsu (transportation) company was located on the second floor.
An3 is now located in the building, but when the building opened, the U-house Keihan Uji limousine center of the defunct Keihan Uji Kotsu (transportation) company was located on the second floor.

An3 (a convenience store) is now located in the building, but when the building opened, the U-house Keihan Uji limousine center of the defunct Keihan Uji Kotsu (transportation) company was located on the second floor.
sen.cmt: アンスリーの補足を追加しました。

sen.j: また、入り口には巨大なステンドグラス障壁画「飛翔」が飾られている。
sen.e: On a wall in the entrace area, an enomous stained glass picture, "Hisho(flight)," is placed.
On a wall in the entrance area, there is an enormous stained-glass picture, "Hisho (Flight)."
On a wall in the entrance area, there is an enormous stained-glass picture, 'Hisho (Flight).'

sen.j: 2002年にリムジンセンターU-ハウス京阪宇治は廃止され、その跡地には塾の京進が入居している。
sen.e: In 2002, the U-house Keihan Uji limousine center was closed, and a Kyoshin cram school is now located there.
The U-house Keihan Uji limousine center was closed in 2002, and a Kyoshin cram school is now located there.
The U-house Keihan Uji limousine center was closed in 2002, and a Kyoshin cram school is now located there.

sen.j: 円を基調とした駅舎は南海電気鉄道の特急南海50000系電車のデザインを手がけた、建築家の若林広幸によって設計され、1996年に私鉄の駅としては初のグッドデザイン賞に選定されている。
sen.e: The circle-based station house was designed by Hiroyuki WAKABAYASHI, who also desinged the Nankai 50000 series train car used by Nankai Electric Railway Co.,Ltd., and in 1996, became the first private company-owned one winning a good design prize.

The circular station house was designed by Hiroyuki WAKABAYASHI, who also designed the Nankai 50000 Series train car used by Nankai Electric Railway Co., Ltd., and in 1996 became the first private company-owned one to win a prize for good design.

The circular station house was designed by Hiroyuki WAKABAYASHI, who also designed the Nankai 50000 Series train car used by Nankai Electric Railway Co., Ltd., and in 1996 became the first private company-owned one to win a prize for good design.

sen.j: 2005年12月には改修工事が行われ、駅名表示板が従来の青色の発色型（蛍光灯）から銀色の非発色型（直接発光しないため表示板の後ろに蛍光灯または電球が設置）の物に付け替えられた。
sen.e: The station was reformed in December of 2005, and the former station name display boards, in which blue fluorescent lamps were used, were replaced with new silver-colored non-self-color-generation-type ones (that do not emit light by themselves and on the rear side of which fluorescent lamps or electric lamps are placed).

The station was revitalized in December 2005, and the former station-name display boards, which employed blue fluorescent lamps, were replaced with new, silver-coated non-self-color-generating ones (that don't emit light by themselves and on the rear side of which fluorescent lamps or electric lamps are placed).

The station was revitalized in December 2005, and the former station-name display boards, which employed blue fluorescent lamps, were replaced with new, silver-coated non-self-color-generating ones (that don't emit light by themselves and on the rear side of which fluorescent lamps or electric lamps are placed).

sen.j: 2000年のダイヤ改正以前は、朝ラッシュ時の下り列車を除き、中書島駅には特急が停車しなかった。
sen.e: Before 2000 when the train operating schedule was changed, no special express train stopped at Chushojima Station except the outbound ones during morning rush hours.
Prior to the year 2000, when the train operating schedule was changed, no special express train stopped at Chushojima Station except the outbound ones during morning rush hours.
Prior to the year 2000, when the train operating schedule was changed, no limited express trains stopped at Chushojima Station except the outbound ones during morning rush hours.

sen.j: また、1998年11月から1999年秋にかけて、行楽シーズンに大阪方面から直通運転を行う「宇治快速」が運転されていた。
sen.e: In the period of November of 1998 to the autumn of 1999, "Uji rapid trains,"providing a through service from the Osaka area, were operated in the seasons in which people enjoy outings.
In the period of November 1998 to the autumn of 1999, "Uji rapid trains," providing through service from the Osaka area, were operated in the seasons in which people enjoyed outings.
In the period of November 1998 to the autumn of 1999, 'Uji rapid trains,' providing through service from the Osaka area, were operated in the seasons in which people enjoyed outings.

sen.j: 京阪線では、路線が通る市の中心部に位置する駅の名称には、守口市駅、枚方市駅のように市名があてられているが、当駅は「市」がつかない唯一の駅である。
sen.e: On the Keihan Line, the city name is usually given to a station that is placed in the central area of a city, such as Moriguchi City Station and Hirakata City Station, but this station is only one in which City is not included in the name.

On the Keihan Line, the city name is usually given to a station located in the central area of a city, such as Moriguchi City Station and Hirakata City Station, but this station is the only one in which "City" isn't included in the name.

On the Keihan Line, the city name is usually given to a station located in the central area of a city, such as Moriguchi City Station and Hirakata City Station, but this station is the only one in which "City" isn't included in the name.

sen.j: なぜか正式名称ではない「京阪宇治」という表記が近年まで用いられていた（補足：かつては周遊指定地接続駅の表記と合わせたり国鉄との連絡運輸の際に国鉄駅と区別するといった理由で、正式名称にはない会社名を付けて表記することが行われていた。
sen.e: The reason is not clear, but the unofficial notation of "Keihan Uji"was used until recently (a supplementary note: In the past, it was customary to use unofficial station names, because it was sometimes necessary to use notations on disignated round-trip tickets and also to differencitate this station from the JR station with the same name in transportation connecting with JR.

The reason isn't clear, but the unofficial notation of "Keihan Uji" was used until recently (in the past, it was customary to use unofficial station names because it was sometimes necessary to use notations on designated round-trip tickets and also to differentiate this station from the JR station with the same name in transportation connecting with JR).

The reason isn't clear, but the unofficial notation of 'Keihan Uji' was used until recently (in the past, it was customary to use unofficial station names because it was sometimes necessary to use notations on designated round-trip tickets and also to differentiate this station from the JR station with the same name in transportation connecting with JR).

sen.j: 現在ではほぼ各社の正式名称で表記されており、宇治駅は数少ない例外だった）。
sen.e: At present, with almost all stations using their official names given by the respective railway companies, the situation around the names of the Uji stations was a rare exception).
Today, with almost all stations using official names given by the respective railway companies, the situation around the names of the Uji stations was a rare exception.
Today, with almost all stations using official names given by the respective railway companies, the situation around the names of the Uji stations was a rare exception.

sen.j: 第1回近畿の駅百選に選定されている。
sen.e: This station was selected in the first event of a selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
This station was chosen in the first selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
This station was chosen in the first selection of 100 prominent stations in the Kinki region.
